page.title: 12Local Churches
page.content:
{Thomas Jones writes -}I live in Rookley and the church I go to is St. Olave's, our{13th C. Parish Church}at Gatcombe. The church is small and peaceful, with bright kneelers and lovely flowers. There is a wooden effigy of a knight crusader in the Sanctury and the stained glass windows were painted by the Pre-Raphaelites.
About 20 of us go the{Sunday School. Once a month we go to Family Service. Both Chillerton and Rookley have Meth- odist Chapels which have Sunday Schools too. There is a lot or unity and support for each others special occasions and services. We enjoy decorating the Church for Harvest Festival and for Christmas and Easter. As Rookley has no C. of E. Church worshippers have to go to Gatcombe or to Godshill or Arreton.
